title: Kris Jenner Gifts Kylie the Most Unexpected Extravagant Birthday Present
content:
• None She just posted two photos of her early birthday gift from her mom, Kris Jenner.
• None The customized piece featured photos of Kylie printed on cards and chips.

Kylie Jenner is feeling like a high roller ahead of her 28th birthday. On Friday, the Khy founder took to Instagram to show off her brand new poker table—complete with a giant red bow—an early birthday present from her mother, Kris Jenner.

"Best birthday gift ever!!!! @krisjenner," Kylie captioned a picture posted to her Stories.

The reality star, who was born on August 10, also shared a more detailed close-up of the table, revealing a custom set of Kylie-branded playing cards and chips.

In July, Kylie summered in Saint-Tropez with a rare handbag on her arm—or rather, head. On Instagram, she shared an inside look at her recent getaway, which included balancing a $74,000 Hermès handbag on her head.

Kylie, her sister Kendall, and their friends lounge at the luxurious Loulou beach club in a series of snaps. Kylie captioned her carousel with a singular emoji: "♾️."

For one outing, the reality star paired a white cutout halter dress with a Kelly Doll Picto. The anthropomorphic take on Hermès's classic Kelly handbag features a pixelated face and three-dimensional arms.

According to Sotheby's, the rare purse, originally introduced in 2000, was rereleased by Hermès in 2022. Retailing at $17,600, a similar model fetched more than double at auction in 2023, totaling $74,000.

In clips posted to her Instagram Stories, Kylie and her friends balance the prized possession on their heads while sipping cocktails.

A month earlier, Kylie revealed that her daughter Stormi isn't a fan of her mom's former wig obsession. In June, she shared a new TikTok with the following caption: "Stormi just discovered the king kylie era."

Kylie used the nickname "King Kylie" in her social media handles during the mid-2010s, when she also experimented with several hair color changes. From teal to bleach blonde to pastel pink, the Kylie Cosmetics founder wore wigs to protect her natural tresses as she switched up looks so often.

Stormi questioned one particular outfit choice of Kylie's, specifically her pairing of a teal wig with an oversized t-shirt back in 2016.

"I know," Kylie agrees. "It's not good."

"It's not a good combo," Stormi concludes in the clip.
summary: Kylie Jenner, the founder of Kylie Cosmetics, has received an unexpected gift from her mother, Kris Jenner, for her 28th birthday. She shared two photos of a custom poker table, complete with a giant red bow, and a detailed close-up of the table, featuring photos of KylIE printed on cards and chips. The gift was an early birthday present from Kylie, who was born on August 10. This follows Kylie's recent trip to Saint-Tropez where she shared a $74,000 Hermès handbag, which was rereleased in 2022 and retails at $17,600. The rare purse was originally introduced in 2000 and retold in 2022, with a similar model expected to fetch more than double at auction in 2023.
shortSummary: Kylie Jenner celebrated her 28th birthday with a custom poker table featuring her photos, while promoting her Hermès handbag sale online.

Kylie Jenner's Daughter Stormi Has the Funniest Reaction to Her Mom's Blue Hair Era Stormi pulled no punches when judging her mom's former fashion choices. By Hannah Malach Published on June 17, 2025 @ 08:54PM Close Kylie Jenner in 2014. Credit: Getty Kylie Jenner's daughter Stormi Webster called out her mom's style in a hilarious new TikTok."Did you dye your hair in that photo?" The seven-year-old asks.Stormi is Jenner's first child with rapper Travis Scott. They also share a son named Aire. Kylie Jenner's daughter Stormi Webster isn't a fan of her mom's former wig obsession. On Monday, the reality star shared a new TikTok with the following caption: "Stormi just discovered the king kylie era." Jenner used the nickname "King Kylie" in her social media handles during the mid-2010s, when she also experimented with several hair color changes. From teal to bleach blonde to pastel pink, the Kylie Cosmetics founder wore wigs to protect her natural tresses as she switched up looks so often. Jenner's latest TikTok depicts Stormi with a surprised look on her face. "Why do you look so shocked?" Jenner asks. "Did you dye your hair in that photo?" Stormi responds. "No, it was a wig," Jenner explains. "Mommy used to love wearing wigs." Stormi questioned one particular outfit choice of Jenner's, specifically her pairing of a teal wig with an oversized t-shirt back in 2016. Kylie Jenner in 2016. Getty "A blue wig with a red outfit?" The seven-year-old inquires. "I know," Jenner agrees. "It's not good." "It's not a good combo," Stormi concludes. Related Stories Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott's Relationship Timeline Kylie Jenner's 26 Most Talked-About Outfits Ever Jenner and rapper Travis Scott welcomed their daughter in 2018. Although they're no longer together, the couple also has a son named Aire, who was born in 2022. Last month, Jenner shared an Instagram tribute to her first child. "You changed my life goosey girl," she captioned the photo of her and Stormi. "Loving you is the easiest thing i have ever done 🤍." Read more: News Celebrity

History of the Hermès Kelly Doll
The Hermès Kelly Doll was first released in 2000 and was designed by Jean-Louis Dumas. The tiny Kelly bag retailed for about $2,500 and was produced in eight colors including Orange H, Rouge H, Black, Noisette, Blue Saphir, Vert Olive, Vert Cru, and Rouge Vif. Orange H and Black are the most common colors available on the secondary market. The popularity of this whimsical Kelly bag wasn't immediate and they were easy to find in the secondary market for close to retail before 2005. The bags have been regularly discontinued and then released in new limited edition colors and materials.
Hermès discontinued the Kelly Doll in 2005 and then started producing limited edition bags in 2008. These Hermès Kelly Doll were mostly to mark the opening of new boutiques around the world. Through 2010 a number of new colors came out of the Pantin ateliers including Blue Jean, and Vermillion. For the 2010 opening of the Sogo boutique in Hong Kong a Kelly Doll was produced in 5P pink. After 2010 the Hermès Kelly Doll was retired again, resulting in renewed interest from collectors and greater demand in the secondary market.
In 2015 Hermès debuted a set of five unique Kelly Dolls Quelle Idole bags at the Leather Forever exhibition in Singapore to represent each decade of Singapore's independence. The pieces featured embroidery, beading, exotic skins and other unique elements and took months to complete. While these bags are though to have sold in a private auction, these bags haven't resurfaced on the secondary market. Beginning in 2017 the Hermès Kelly Doll was no longer produced just for store openings or special events. Hermès now offers the Kelly Doll to its top clients, including the ability to purchase special order bags in a range or colors and exotic leathers.
Hermès Kelly Doll Picto
Hermès introduced the newest Kelly Doll as part of its Spring/Summer 2022 collection. The new Hermès Kelly Doll Picto is a completely redesigned and re-imagined take on the Hermès Kelly Doll. The new design comes with a shoulder strap and has a pixel art style complete with a little backpack. The new Hermès Kelly Doll Picto comes in Epsom leather and was initially released in three colors: Mauve Sylvestre, Nata and Bleu Saphir. It retailed for about $15,600 when it was first released in 2022 and now retails for $17,600 at Hermès boutiques in the US (updated in 2025).
Hermès Kelly Doll Picto Price
The most expensive Hermès Kelly Doll Picto sold for 571,500 HKD ($74,000) in 2023. It was the first Blue Saphir Kelly Doll Picto sold at Sotheby's. The first Kelly Doll Pictos to sell at Sotheby's in June 2023 sold for between $53,000 - $57,000 and where a Kelly Doll Picto Nata and Kelly Doll Picto Mauve Sylvestre. Prices for the Kelly Doll Picto have remained around $50,000 to $60,000 in 2024. As new colors are released, we anticipate some colors could sell at the higher end of the range within 12 months of being released. The first Gold Kelly Doll Picto sold at Sotheby's for $54,000 in February 2025.
Advantages to Collecting Hermès Kelly Bags on the Secondary Market
1. Access
Sotheby's is able to provide access to a curated selection of Hermès Kelly bags from its long established global network of sellers including the newest Kelly Doll Picto. Sotheby's is a leading global marketplace that offers pristine Kelly bags in the most popular colors, materials and sizes along with rare Himalayan and Limited Edition Kelly bags. Our handbag specialists are always sourcing the most desirable Hermès Kelly bags from collectors around the world. Sotheby's also sells incredible private collections that include one of a kind HSS Kelly bags.
2. Flexibility
Sotheby's provides multiple ways to purchase Kelly bags including auction, online and in person in New York, Hong Kong, Zurich, Paris and London. Sotheby's also offers a concierge service if you need assistance sourcing a specific Hermès Kelly Doll Picto that isn't available at auction or online.
3. Value
While Kelly bags in pristine condition sell at a premium to retail, Sotheby's has bags for purchase at auction and marketplace in a range of the most desirable colors and materials. Secondary marketplaces like Sotheby's allow a buyer to purchase a store fresh pristine Kelly bag with the original box and all plastic still on the hardware without waiting for a call from an Hermès sales associate. While it is possible to purchase a Kelly bag at an Hermès boutique, it is hard to predict how long it will take. Additionally if you don't have an existing relationship at the store, it is even harder to pick the exact bag including size, color and hardware. In many cases you may be offered a Kelly bag that may not be your desired color or size. Buyers also come to Sotheby's since they want to purchase more than two Kelly bags in a year. While we encourage you to build a relationship with an Hermès Sales Associate, Sotheby's can save you time when purchasing a Kelly bag.
4. Discovery
One of the best parts of a global luxury marketplace is discovering unique one of a kind Kelly bags or rare limited edition Kelly bags that are no longer available at Hermès. Sotheby's curated selection changes regularly and each auction has a unique selection of Kelly bags including the popular Mini Kelly bag. You are likely to discover something new to you from Hermès.
Buying and Selling a Kelly Bag at Sotheby's
Sotheby's always has a curated selection of Hermès Kelly bags available for immediate shipping. Sotheby's also sells Hermès Kelly bags at auction in New York, Paris, Zurich and Hong Kong. Expect to find rare and collectible Kelly bags including the popular Kelly doll in pristine and excellent condition. Sotheby's sells Kelly bags in the newest colors and classic neutrals in leather and exotic materials along with collectible Limited Edition Kelly bags. Prices for Kelly bags in pristine condition generally start around $20,000 and can exceed $100,000 for Himalaya and Diamond Mini Kelly bags.
- Explore upcoming handbag auctions in New York, London, Switzerland, Paris, and Hong Kong.
- Speak to a Salon Associate in New York, Zurich, London, Paris, or Hong Kong to schedule an appointment.
- Contact a Handbag Specialist about selling an Hermès Kelly bag or submit your item here for valuation.
Trust our worldwide network of leading handbag specialists from a globally renowned auction house established in 1744.

The History Behind the Iconic Hermès Kelly Bag The Birkin’s chic older sister. By Shelby Comroe Shelby Comroe Shelby Comroe is a New York City-based fashion editor and writer. InStyle's editorial guidelines Updated on March 31, 2024 @ 10:52AM In This Article View All In This Article Origins of the Kelly Bag Grace Kelly's Influence Breaking Down the Bag Variations of the Kelly Bag The Takeaway Close Credit: Getty Images Trends come and go, but a select few iconic pieces have consistently stood the test of time. Consider the Hermès Birkin (introduced in 1984), the Chanel Classic Flap (1955), the Gucci Jackie (1961), and The Lady Dior (1995); these are not merely accessories, but pieces of fashion history. These handbags routinely appear on lists highlighting “it-bags,” “best investment bags,” and “most classic bags” a testament to their unwavering popularity and iconic status. However, it's important to acknowledge the original that set the stage for all others: the Hermès Kelly. Introduced in 1935, the Kelly bag pioneered the concept of the luxury “it-bag.” Origins of the Kelly Bag Let’s do a brief deep-dive on the history of Hermès. The brand was established in 1837 by Thierry Hermès, initially starting as a harness workshop (hence the ever-present equestrian influence.) In the late 19th and early 20th centuries, under the leadership of Thierry's son, Charles-Émile Hermès, the company expanded its product range to include saddlery and began retailing at 24 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honoré in Paris, which remains its flagship store today. The 1930s marked a pivotal period for Hermès, with Émile Hermès’ son-in-law, Robert Dumas, joining the business. Dumas was instrumental in diversifying the brand's offerings, introducing some of Hermès' most iconic creations, like the silk scarf, Chaîne d’Ancre bracelet, and the revolutionary Sac à Dépêches, later known as the Kelly bag. His vision and creativity during this period significantly shaped the brand's identity, cementing its status in the luxury goods market. The introduction of the Sac à Dépêches was revolutionary for the time. Drawing inspiration from the Haut à Courroies (HAC) bag, designed for equestrian gear, Dumas reimagined it into the more compact Sac à Dépêches. Known for its distinctive trapezoid shape, single handle, and strap closures with a center toggle, the Kelly bag represented a significant departure from the era's smaller purses, essentially creating the first modern "handbag" as we know it. Each Kelly bag, handcrafted by a single artisan over 18 to 25 hours, showcases Hermès' commitment to exclusivity and craftsmanship, available in various sizes, colors, and materials, including luxurious leathers and exotic skins. SEBASTIEN BOZON/AFP via Getty Images Grace Kelly's Influence Twenty years after the Hermès Sac à Dépêches was first designed, it landed the role of a lifetime in the glamorous world of cinema. The 1955 Alfred Hitchcock classic, "To Catch a Thief," featured this iconic piece, thanks to 8-time Academy Award-winning costume designer, Edith Head. The film, starring Hollywood legends Cary Grant and Grace Kelly, became a backdrop for showcasing luxury and style. Grace Kelly's character, Frances Stevens, a wealthy American heiress vacationing on the French Riviera, epitomized 1950s glamor. Her wardrobe, filled with stunning gowns and chic ensembles, mirrored her sophisticated and affluent lifestyle, attending high-society events and staying at the finest hotels. Understanding the need for Frances's accessories to reflect her status, Edith Head selected the Hermes Sac à Dépêches to complement Kelly's character. This decision not only highlighted Frances's wealth but also marked the beginning of the bag's journey into fashion history. At the time, Grace Kelly was one of the most famous figures worldwide. Her fondness for the Sac à Dépêches was so great that rumors swirled about her refusal to part with the bag even after filming concluded. In a turn of events mirroring a story straight out of Hollywood, Kelly transitioned from the silver screen's royalty to actual monarchy by marrying Prince Rainier III of Monaco in 1956. The world was captivated by this real-life fairy tale, with the paparazzi desperate to capture every moment of the couple's life. The fascination with Kelly's new royal life reached a peak when she was photographed in 1956 using the Hermès Sac à Dépêches bag to hide her pregnancy bump. This iconic image graced the cover of Life magazine and catapulted the bag to unprecedented fame, marking its evolution into the world's first "it-bag." Women worldwide flooded Hermès boutiques looking for the “Kelly Bag.” Hermés officially renamed the bag in 1977. Keystone-France/Gamma-Rapho via Getty Images Breaking Down the Bag Now that we’ve gone over the history behind the bag let’s break things down even further. First things first, the Kelly Bag has two different styles: Sellier and Retourne. The Hermès Kelly Sellier, the bag's original style, pays homage to the brand's equestrian heritage with its name, "Sellier," meaning saddler in French. Characterized by its visible stitching and pronounced edges, the Kelly Sellier showcases the meticulous craftsmanship synonymous with Hermès. Artisans stitch the bag from the outside in, finishing it with a resin edge coat that ensures sharp, clean lines and a polished finish. The Sellier's distinct structure and rigidity are attributed to the use of hard leathers, such as the durable Epsom leather or the classic Box leather. These materials not only contribute to the bag's longevity but also help maintain its iconic trapezoidal shape. The Kelly Retourne is the more relaxed version of the Kelly bag. The term "Retourne," meaning "to turn over" in French, aptly describes the bag's construction process. In contrast to the Sellier, the Retourne is crafted with the stitching on the inside before being turned outward, meaning the stitching is not visible. As opposed to the resin edges on the Sellier, the Kelly Retourne has leather piping along the sides, and the edges are rounded giving it a more relaxed shape. The leather used for the Retourne is softer and more supple, such as the Togo or the Clemence. Due to the softness in the leather Retourne Kelly bags tend to be or become slouchier and have a more casual look. The sizing of the Hermès Kelly bag is determined by the length of its base, for example, the Kelly 32, which measures 32 centimeters across. The sizes range from 15 to 50. The Kelly 15 and 20 are categorized as mini bags, ideal for evening wear or light day use. On the other end of the spectrum, the Kelly 40 and 50 serve as large travel bags. For daily use, the Kelly 25 and 28 are the most sought-after sizes, striking a balance between functionality and elegance. Each Kelly bag is thoughtfully equipped with a matching crossbody strap, enhancing its utility and offering varied ways to wear it. Each style is available in an array of colors, leathers, and hardware—classic Kelly’s are made with either gold or palladium hardware. Of course, this is Hermès and there is the option (if you’re lucky) to special order. Which opens up a whole other world of hardware options, leathers, colors, and sizes. Now that we've explored the distinct styles, construction methods, and sizing options of the Hermès Kelly bag, it's clear that this iconic piece is more than just an accessory. With such a wide array of choices, selecting the perfect Kelly bag can seem daunting. To aid in this decision, we turned to an expert in the field. Jeremy Moeller/Getty Images We asked Kelly McSweeney, Senior Merchandising Manager at The RealReal, to share her thoughts on the different sizes, extensive leather, and hardware combinations. McSweeney shares, “I think the size 25 is the perfect size. It's still a smaller bag, but fits all of your daily necessities and can comfortably be worn crossbody, so one could argue that this is a ‘practical’ purchase. The mini size 20 is definitely the most sought after and the prices reflect that. For leathers, they really are all beautiful and of the highest quality, but Togo and Epsom leathers would be more durable and resistant to scratches, so would give me peace of mind for everyday wear. For hardware, I would say that gold is most often in the highest demand. And for leather color, I think brown (named Gold) is the chicest classic option, and you can of course never go wrong with black. Hermes makes such beautiful rich colors that the pinks and greens/blues are often quite sought after as well. Lastly, I would also recommend vintage! The vintage Kelly bags are unbelievably special and showcase how iconic and long-standing this style really is.” Variations of the Kelly Bag Hermès, a brand synonymous with unparalleled luxury and exclusivity, has crafted an array of iterations of the iconic Kelly bag. Below, we will explore the diverse range of Kelly styles that continue to captivate fashion lovers and collectors, including those still in production and highly sought-after limited-edition pieces that have become coveted treasures. To kick off this list we turned to our favorite “chief bag officer” and the brains behind @y2kbags on Instagram about their favorite version of the Kelly Bag. “I love the Hermes Kelly Lakis Bag! Introduced in 2004, it comes in 4 different sizes which include 28, 32, 35, and 40. The Kelly Lakis came to fruition after a VIP customer, Lakis Gavalas, requested the iconic bag with external pockets featured in the front and back. Fast forward 2 years, and with Jean Paul Gaultier as creative Director, the bag was released to the public! I love this design because I think of it as utilitarian chic. I've been so obsessed with the concept of the cargo bag, and this style of the Kelly serves exactly that purpose! This style comes in an array of colors and materials, including leather and toile. This is definitely a Kelly to covet and fetches a fairly high resale value in the secondary market depending on condition.” The Kelly Pochette Edward Berthelot/Getty Images The Hermès Kelly Pochette, a hallmark of Jean Paul Gaultier’s first collection for Hermès in 2004, is considered the original Mini Kelly. This elegant clutch differentiates itself with a less structured silhouette compared to its Mini Kelly counterpart, offering a more relaxed take on the iconic design. Unlike the Mini Kelly, which serves dual purposes as both a clutch and a shoulder bag thanks to its removable strap, the Kelly Pochette is designed exclusively as a clutch. It's one of Hermès' most sought-after pieces. The Kelly Cut Christian Vierig/Getty Images Introduced in 2008, the Kelly Cut presents a sleek silhouette with its 31cm length, setting it apart from the more compact 22cm Kelly Pochette. This elongated design is the defining characteristic of the Kelly Cut, adding a sense of drama and sophistication. Its distinctive shape makes it an ideal evening option. The Kelly Elan Peter White/Getty Images Introduced in the early 2000s as an elegant clutch, the Hermes Kelly Elan swiftly emerged as a sought-after item. Its initial production lasted just two years, making it a coveted and incredibly rare piece among fashion lovers. Despite this brief production period, the allure of the Kelly Elan endured, leading to its re-release in 2023, now designed with a detachable shoulder strap for added versatility. The Kelly Danse Claudio Lavenia/Getty Images The Kelly Danse was designed by Jean-Paul Gaultier in 2013, it was discontinued in 2013 and then reintroduced in 2019 as the Kelly Danse II. The Kelly Danse is a more laidback take on the classic bag due to its versatility and elongated top strap. This bag can be worn in many different ways such as crossbody, belt bag, shoulder bag, clutch, and even a backpack thanks to its adjustable straps. The So Kelly Stephane Cardinale/Corbis via Getty Images Another gem designed in 2008 by Jean-Paul Gaultier is The So Kelly. It’s a blend between a hobo bag and a bucket bag. The Osier Wicker Picnic Kelly Edward Berthelot/Getty Images The Osier Wicker, or "Picnic Kelly," debuted on the runway in 2011, drawing inspiration from the quintessential picnic basket with its Osier woven wicker body and Barénia leather trim. Wicker's challenging and delicate nature highlights the extraordinary skill of Hermès artisans in creating this bag. Over the years, Hermès has revisited the Picnic concept with limited editions, including a Mini Picnic Kelly 20 and reissues of the original Kelly 35 size, all in very limited quantities. This rarity has made the Picnic Kelly highly sought after among collectors. The Kelly Doll Jeremy Moeller/Getty Images The Kelly Doll was originally designed by Hermès' then-creative head Jean-Louis Dumas in 2000. Characterized by its whimsical design that incorporates elements of the classic Kelly bag into a doll-like figure, the Kelly Doll quickly captured the hearts of Hermès enthusiasts. However, in 2005, Hermès discontinued the production of the Kelly Doll, only to reintroduce it in 2008 as a series of limited edition releases. These special editions were often linked to the celebration of new boutique openings, each marked with a foil stamp indicating the specific store the bag was designed for. Transitioning from its initial role in commemorating store openings and special events, from 2017 onwards, the Kelly Doll became an exclusive offering to Hermès' top clients. The Kelly Doll Picto Edward Berthelot/Getty Images Hermès created an updated version of the Kelly Doll in 2022: The Kelly Doll Picto. The Teddy Kelly Giovanni Giannoni/Getty Images The Teddy Kelly, was first introduced by Jean Paul Gaultier for the Fall/Winter 2005 collection, and it made a reappearance on the Fall/Winter 2011 runway. Crafted in luxurious Doblis suede, this bag was offered in larger sizes including the 32 and 35. Hermès introduced a limited-edition Mini Teddy Kelly 20 bag in Grizzly Suede in 2023. This smaller version, with its rich texture and compact size, quickly became one of the most coveted and rarest Mini Kelly bags in the Hermès collection. The Sterling Silver Mini Kelly Giovanni Giannoni/Getty Images Among the most exclusive and sought-after Hermès pieces is the Sterling Silver Mini Kelly. This exquisite bag distinguishes itself with a striking chrome finish and a detachable Chaîne d'Ancre strap. Unlike its traditional leather counterparts, the Sterling Silver Mini Kelly features a unique hinged opening at the top, setting it apart in both functionality and design. Its rarity is underscored by the limited number of pieces available worldwide, making each one a treasured collector's item. One of these bags was auctioned at Christie’s online in December 2023 and sold for $214,000. The Kelly en Désordre Victor VIRGILE/Gamma-Rapho via Getty Images The Kelly en Désordre made a memorable appearance on the runway at the Hermès Women's Fall/Winter 2022 show, captivating onlookers with its innovative double-sided design. This distinctive feature allows for openings on both sides of the bag, each sealed with its own angled flap, sangle, and iconic turn lock. One flap opens to the main compartment while the other flap opens to a small pouch. Adding to its practicality, the bag is equipped with a non-detachable shoulder strap. The Takeaway For over eight decades, the Hermès Kelly bag has epitomized classic elegance and luxury at its finest. Its journey from a practical accessory to the first "it-bag" is a testament to its timeless design and the profound impact of Grace Kelly's iconic moment. This evolution not only cemented the Kelly bag's place in fashion history but also paved the way for the emergence of must-have accessories in the luxury domain. In tribute to its lasting legacy, we've spotlighted a list of modern moments that reaffirm the Kelly bag's unwavering status. Read more: Fashion Accessories Bags

12 of Kylie Jenner’s Most Iconic Hair Moments You’ll Want to Recreate By Elise Tabin Elise Tabin Elise Minton Tabin is an award-winning beauty journalist, editor, and expert with more than 16 years of experience. InStyle's editorial guidelines Published on December 9, 2024 @ 06:30PM Close Credit: Getty Images Kylie Jenner is a true hair chameleon. Whether rocking a pink shaggy wig, waist-length extensions, or a sleek bob in an array of rainbow colors, the beauty entrepreneur can pull off an array of different styles and colors. "From bold, dramatic transformations to sleek, minimalist looks, Kylie Jenner's hair is an integral part of her fashion evolution," says Jerome Lordet, owner and director of Jerome Lordet Salon. While Jenner may be embracing her natural hair more these days, we're taking a trip down memory lane and revisiting some of her best hair moments, past and present. Meet the expert Andrew Fitzsimons is a celebrity hairstylist who has worked with Jenner and is also the founder of Andrew Fitzsimons Hair and creator of BELLAMI x Andrew Fitzsimons ponytail. Jerome Lordet is the owner and director of Jerome Lordet Salon. 01 of 12 An Avant-Garde Updo Getty Images Never afraid to take risks with her hairstyles, Jenner paired a feather-covered dress with a unique take on her classic slicked-back ponytail. Instead of letting the hair flow freely from the pony, she wore a dramatic blunt-cut hairpiece that covered the back of her head, giving way to an asymmetrical bob-like look. A good smoothing product like Andrew Fitzsimons Fantasy Curl Serum helps to tame flyaways and frizz. 02 of 12 Old Hollywood Glam Getty Images Here, Jenner takes a page out of the old Hollywood glam playbook with sculpted waves cascading across one eye and a deep side part. Fitzsimons says she has the perfect features of high cheekbones, a sharp jawline, and bright eyes for an old Hollywood look. "When creating these styles for her, the goal is to honor the classic elements while giving them a fresh, modern twist. Adding extra texture, a sleek hairline, or pairing the look with a bold lip is Kylie's signature style." 03 of 12 Soft and Sexy Waves @kyliejenner/Instagram This Kylie Jenner hairstyle is a nod to beach waves but done with more softness and sex appeal, which she wears frequently. "A blown-out, sultry look for Kylie is about creating volume, movement, and just the right amount of polish to make it effortlessly cool," Fitzsimon says. "For added dimension, I love using BELLAMI Silk Seam Clip-ins, which blend seamlessly into the hair." He adds that the foundation of her style is everything, which starts with a proper blow dry with a round brush followed by either a large barrel curling iron or rollers to create her soft, natural-looking waves. 04 of 12 Cropped Blonde @kyliejenner/Instagram For Kylie's return to her King Kylie persona (when she constantly changed her hair), she sported a platinum blonde curly bob that suited her skin tone and made her dark eyes pop. However, pulling off a platinum blonde crop isn't for everyone, and considering your skin tone is key. To prevent cool-toned blonde hair, like Kylie's, from falling flat and looking brassy, Lordet recommends maintaining the hair regularly to prevent the color from turning yellow and the hair from becoming damaged. 05 of 12 The Wet Hair Look Getty Images With her "wet" hair falling over one eye and a deep side part, Jenner's sultry hairstyle is a sleek trend that she pulls off well. Although the dripping wet look takes a lot of time to create and requires a hefty serving of either hair oil or gel, Fitzsimons says the key to Jenner's wet hair look is the perfect balance between polished and edgy. "This style is perfect for her because it emphasizes her beautiful bone structure. The sleekness of her hair draws attention to her cheekbones and jawline in a way that makes her look perfectly sculpted." 06 of 12 Extra Long Length Jenner always dresses the part when she's in Paris. At the 2024 Acne Studios Spring runway show, she debuted a wispy French fringe and raven-toned hair. According to Lordet, her return to long, jet-black hair was an ultra-glamorous moment that created a high-contrast look, evoking both mystery and elegance. "This is one of her most glamorous looks because it offers sophistication and maturity." Extra-long shaggy extensions give the perfect amount of drama and glam. 07 of 12 Barbie Pink @kyliejenner/Instagram Of all the hair colors that Kylie sports, pink is her go-to. Her bright, bubblegum-pink strands are likely courtesy of a wig (she's also known to slip on rose gold and other cotton candy-hued wigs). Lordet says her pink hair features hints of warm tones for a bold choice that suits her evolving style perfectly. "This color is flattering against her skin, creating a balanced, vibrant look." 08 of 12 Baby Blue Bob Getty Images Both dusty and more vibrant shades of blues and teals are one color family that Kylie returns to over and over. As a teenager, she wore blue hair frequently and kept the root heavy for a more lived-in, low-maintenance look. If you're considering a color like this one, Lordet says there are a few things to keep in mind to make it work. "With any vibrant color, the key to maintaining it is healthy hair. Start with strong, well-moisturized hair and use deep conditioning masks or oil treatments regularly to keep the strands smooth and shiny." 09 of 12 Platinum Blonde Getty Images In the past, Jenner has achieved her icy blonde platinum color with seamless-looking wigs, although she also bleached her hair to a lighter shade of pale. Since bleached blonde hair can lose its luster and shine, wigs are a far safer choice, but choosing one with the right tone of blonde is key. "Her platinum blonde hair contrasts beautifully with her skin tone, and the blunt bob shape accentuates her strong jawline and cheekbones," Lordet says. "This hairstyle gives an almost futuristic, high-fashion edge that felt very much in line with the bold, boundary-pushing persona she was cultivating at the time." 10 of 12 Brow-Skimming Bangs Getty Images In true Jenner fashion, she always keeps her looks fresh and unexpected. At the 2015 MTV Video Music Awards, she sported a classic blowout with some bend on the ends and loads of shine throughout. A heavy jet-black fringe hits right at her eyebrows, creating the perfect eye frame. For added dimension, Fitzsimons recommends clip-ins like the BELLAMI Silk Seam Clip-ins, which he says can be used to achieve all types of long and short styles. 11 of 12 Mermaid Vibes @kyliejenner/Instagram When Jenner wears her hair super long, courtesy of extensions, she often relies on a loose, wavy, mermaid-inspired style. With her waist-skimming strands that have a polished yet bohemian feel to them, her down-to-there style evokes a moment of true sophistication. "Kylie's return to long, jet-black hair with a deep part offers a sense of maturity while still being fresh," Lordet adds. 12 of 12 Bun Babe Getty Images Kylie loves to wear her hair in a mélange of different bun styles, from an overly sized one, as shown here and adorned with a diamond-encrusted headpiece fit for royalty, to smaller top knots and messy chignons. Pulling her hair up and off her face allows her facial features and perfectly defined cheekbones and jawline to take center stage. Read more: Beauty Hair

argos_summary: Kylie Jenner showcased her early birthday gift from her mother, Kris Jenner, on Instagram—a customized poker table adorned with her photos and a set of Kylie-branded playing cards and chips. The reality star, who turns 28 on August 10, expressed her excitement, calling it the 'best birthday gift ever.' Additionally, Kylie shared glimpses of her luxurious summer in Saint-Tropez, where she was seen balancing a $74,000 Hermès handbag on her head.
